intro: Cryptanthus ubairensis, commonly known as the Brazilian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces showy inflorescences that bloom in the spring. Cryptanthus ubairensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
